content.title: Tibial-Pedal Bypass for Limb Salvage
content.statement: Tibial-Pedal Bypass for Limb Salvage is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Pad that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Tibial-Pedal Bypass for Limb Salvage helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Tibial-Pedal Bypass for Limb Salvage include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Tibial-Pedal Bypass for Limb Salvage.

dorsalis_pedis.location: Dorsum of foot, between 1st and 2nd metatarsals
dorsalis_pedis.exposure: Dorsal foot incision, lateral to EHL tendon

lateral_plantar.location: Deep sole, coursing laterally then arching medially
lateral_plantar.exposure: Medial plantar incision, release abductor hallucis

common_plantar.consideration: May be only available target in severe disease

indications: Patent pedal arch or pedal vessel segment
contraindications: No patent pedal target on imaging
No adequate vein conduit (even with splicing)
Non-ambulatory patient with limited life expectancy
Extensive forefoot necrosis requiring amputation anyway
preoperative_requirements: Detailed angiographic assessment of pedal vessels

anastomosis.technique: Parachute technique helpful in deep locations

conduit_management.orientation: Reversed vein most common for long bypasses
conduit_management.in_situ: Consider if short bypass from tibial source

predictors_of_success: Patent pedal arch or good collaterals
predictors_of_failure: Poor vein quality or small caliber

monitoring.frequency: Weekly duplex for first month, then monthly

definition.@value: Autogenous vein bypass targeting the pedal arteries for limb salvage when tibial vessels are inadequate.

presentation: Patent pedal arch segment on imaging
diagnosis: Wound assessment for realistic salvage potential

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Tibial-Pedal Bypass for Limb Salvage. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Describe pedal artery anatomy and exposure techniques
Explain conduit requirements for pedal bypass
Discuss realistic expectations for pedal bypass outcomes
clinical_pearls: Pedal bypass can save limbs when all else seems lost
Vein quality is the single most important factor
Loupe magnification or microscope essential for 2mm anastomoses
Limb salvage rate exceeds patency rate - even failed bypass may heal wound
Don't give up on CLTI patients - always evaluate for pedal targets
